Mixed-Up Traffic plan  To .The News and Courier:  "This traffic stranguation has  plenty of Charlestonians hot under  their coars. I"m not a Charleston-  ian, but et me te you, my coar  is hot, too; and, I might add, here"s  the reason why.  To begin: Before the Smith-Dibbe traffic plan" was ever put into  operation, the merchants of this  town cried "Down with The plan".  And within a week after, the plan  was adopted, a petition was start-"  ed to change it-which finay sue-.  ceeded.  Now, in Wednesday"s paper we  read, "Asked yesterday if the aternative traffic plan,   which has  been effective since February 5.  had- prduced any noticeable effect  on King street business, Sidney C.  Snegrove, Jr., president of the  merchants associaltion, said it was  TOO EARY to determine effects,  -if any."  It would seem that the merchants aren"t capable of taking defeat. I am of unbiased opinion on this  street condition, but- what really  makes me mad is, this three-man  committee. This Isn"t Russia; This  is America.
